title: Antonio Meucci
summary: Antonio Santi Giuseppe Meucci (/meɪˈuːtʃi/ may-OO-chee,[1] Italian: [anˈtɔːnjo meˈuttʃi]; 13 April 1808 – 18 October 1889) was an Italian inventor and an associate of Giuseppe Garibaldi, a major political figure in the history of Italy.[2][3] Meucci is best known for developing a voice-communication apparatus that several sources credit as the first telephone.[4][5]
